intro: Hieracium petrosae, commonly known as the rock hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the rocky and alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its leaves are basal and often covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium petrosae is known for its hardy nature and ability to colonize disturbed or rocky areas.
